  <img src="glutamato monossodico.png" alt="Glutamato monossódico" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Monosodium glutamate:</strong> flavor enhancer found in processed foods. Stimulates the umami taste, associated with broths and meats.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CN1C=NC2=C1C(=O)N(C(=O)N2C)C">
  <img src="cafeína.png" alt="Cafeína" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Caffeine:</strong> bitter-tasting compound found in coffee, tea, and chocolate. Also acts as a nervous system stimulant.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=CC(C)/C=C/CCCCC(=O)NCC1=CC(=C(C=C1)O)OC">
  <img src="caps.png" alt="Capsaicina" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Capsaicin:</strong> responsible for the spiciness of peppers. Activates heat receptors, causing a burning sensation.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?model=C(C(=O)O)C(CC(=O)O)(C(=O)O)O">
  <img src="ácido citrico.png" alt="Ácido cítrico" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Citric acid:</strong> found in citrus fruits such as lemons and oranges. Gives a sour and refreshing taste.</p>
